label: 北条泰時
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Hōjō Yasutoki (J.) 北条泰時, clerical name of 観阿 Kan'a. This powerful member of the bakufu was the son of shogunal regent Yoshitoki (1163-1224), and himself became regent in 1224. He established the assembly of justice (評定衆 hyōjōshū in 1225 and the set of laws 御成敗式目 Goseibai shikimoku in 1232, both of which were key elements in the administrative stabilization of shogunal governance. He died in 1142 at the age of 59.
